elements.name: Hydrogen
elements.summary: Hydrogen is a chemical element with chemical symbol H and atomic number 1. It is the lightest element on the periodic table.

elements.name: Helium
elements.summary: Helium is a chemical element with symbol He and atomic number 2. It is a colorless, odorless, tasteless, non-toxic, inert, monatomic gas.

elements.name: Lithium
elements.summary: Lithium is a chemical element with the symbol Li and atomic number 3. It is a soft, silver-white metal belonging to the alkali metal group.

elements.name: Beryllium
elements.summary: Beryllium is a chemical element with symbol Be and atomic number 4. It is a relatively rare element in the universe.

elements.name: Boron
elements.summary: Boron is a chemical element with symbol B and atomic number 5. Produced entirely by cosmic ray spallation and supernovae and not by stellar nucleosynthesis.

elements.name: Carbon
elements.summary: Carbon is a chemical element with symbol C and atomic number 6. It is nonmetallic and tetravalent—making four electrons available to form covalent chemical bonds.

elements.name: Nitrogen
elements.summary: Nitrogen is a chemical element with symbol N and atomic number 7. It was first discovered and isolated by Scottish physician Daniel Rutherford in 1772.

elements.name: Oxygen
elements.summary: Oxygen is a chemical element with symbol O and atomic number 8. It is a member of the chalcogen group on the periodic table.

elements.name: Fluorine
elements.summary: Fluorine is a chemical element with symbol F and atomic number 9. It is the lightest halogen and exists as a highly toxic pale yellow diatomic gas at standard conditions.

elements.name: Neon
elements.summary: Neon is a chemical element with symbol Ne and atomic number 10. It is a noble gas.

elements.name: Sodium
elements.summary: Sodium is a chemical element with symbol Na and atomic number 11. It is a soft, silvery-white, highly reactive metal.

elements.name: Magnesium
elements.summary: Magnesium is a chemical element with symbol Mg and atomic number 12. It is a shiny gray solid which bears a close physical resemblance to the other five elements in the second column of the periodic table.

elements.name: Aluminum
elements.summary: Aluminum is a chemical element with symbol Al and atomic number 13. It is a silvery-white, soft, nonmagnetic, ductile metal in the boron group.

elements.name: Silicon
elements.summary: Silicon is a chemical element with symbol Si and atomic number 14. It is a hard and brittle crystalline solid with a blue-grey metallic lustre.

elements.name: Phosphorus
elements.summary: Phosphorus is a chemical element with symbol P and atomic number 15. Elemental phosphorus exists in two major forms, white phosphorus and red phosphorus.

elements.name: Sulfur
elements.summary: Sulfur is a chemical element with symbol S and atomic number 16. It is abundant, multivalent, and nonmetallic.

elements.name: Chlorine
elements.summary: Chlorine is a chemical element with symbol Cl and atomic number 17. The second-lightest of the halogens, it appears between fluorine and bromine in the periodic table.

elements.name: Argon
elements.summary: Argon is a chemical element with symbol Ar and atomic number 18. It is in group 18 of the periodic table and is a noble gas.

elements.name: Potassium
elements.summary: Potassium is a chemical element with symbol K and atomic number 19. Elemental potassium is a soft silvery-white alkali metal that oxidizes rapidly in air.

elements.name: Calcium
elements.summary: Calcium is a chemical element with symbol Ca and atomic number 20. An alkaline earth metal, calcium is a reactive pale yellow metal.

elements.name: Scandium
elements.summary: Scandium is a chemical element with symbol Sc and atomic number 21. A silvery-white metallic d-block element.

elements.name: Titanium
elements.summary: Titanium is a chemical element with symbol Ti and atomic number 22. It is a lustrous transition metal with a silver color, low density, and high strength.

elements.name: Vanadium
elements.summary: Vanadium is a chemical element with symbol V and atomic number 23. It is a hard, silvery grey, ductile and malleable transition metal.

elements.name: Chromium
elements.summary: Chromium is a chemical element with symbol Cr and atomic number 24. It is the first element in Group 6.

elements.name: Manganese
elements.summary: Manganese is a chemical element with symbol Mn and atomic number 25. It is not found as a free element in nature.

elements.name: Iron
elements.summary: Iron is a chemical element with symbol Fe and atomic number 26. It is a metal in the first transition series.

elements.name: Cobalt
elements.summary: Cobalt is a chemical element with symbol Co and atomic number 27. Like nickel, cobalt is found in the Earth's crust only in chemically combined form.

elements.name: Nickel
elements.summary: Nickel is a chemical element with symbol Ni and atomic number 28. It is a silvery-white lustrous metal with a slight golden tinge.

elements.name: Copper
elements.summary: Copper is a chemical element with symbol Cu and atomic number 29. It is a soft, malleable, and ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity.

elements.name: Zinc
elements.summary: Zinc is a chemical element with symbol Zn and atomic number 30. It is the first element in group 12 of the periodic table.

elements.name: Gallium
elements.summary: Gallium is a chemical element with symbol Ga and atomic number 31. Elemental gallium does not occur in nature.

elements.name: Germanium
elements.summary: Germanium is a chemical element with symbol Ge and atomic number 32. It is a lustrous, hard, grayish-white metalloid in the carbon group.

elements.name: Arsenic
elements.summary: Arsenic is a chemical element with symbol As and atomic number 33. Arsenic occurs in many minerals, usually in combination with sulfur and metals.

elements.name: Selenium
elements.summary: Selenium is a chemical element with symbol Se and atomic number 34. It is a nonmetal with properties that are intermediate between the elements above and below in the periodic table.

elements.name: Bromine
elements.summary: Bromine is a chemical element with symbol Br and atomic number 35. It is the third-lightest halogen, and is a fuming red-brown liquid at room temperature.

elements.name: Krypton
elements.summary: Krypton is a chemical element with symbol Kr and atomic number 36. It is a member of group 18 noble gases.

elements.name: Rubidium
elements.summary: Rubidium is a chemical element with symbol Rb and atomic number 37.

elements.name: Strontium
elements.summary: Strontium is a chemical element with symbol Sr and atomic number 38.

elements.name: Yttrium
elements.summary: Yttrium is a chemical element with symbol Y and atomic number 39.

elements.name: Zirconium
elements.summary: Zirconium is a chemical element with symbol Zr and atomic number 40.

elements.name: Niobium
elements.summary: Niobium is a chemical element with symbol Nb and atomic number 41.

elements.name: Molybdenum
elements.summary: Molybdenum is a chemical element with symbol Mo and atomic number 42.

elements.name: Technetium
elements.summary: Technetium is a chemical element with symbol Tc and atomic number 43.

elements.name: Ruthenium
elements.summary: Ruthenium is a chemical element with symbol Ru and atomic number 44.

elements.name: Rhodium
elements.summary: Rhodium is a chemical element with symbol Rh and atomic number 45.

elements.name: Palladium
elements.summary: Palladium is a chemical element with symbol Pd and atomic number 46.

elements.name: Silver
elements.summary: Silver is a chemical element with symbol Ag and atomic number 47.

elements.name: Cadmium
elements.summary: Cadmium is a chemical element with symbol Cd and atomic number 48.

elements.name: Indium
elements.summary: Indium is a chemical element with symbol In and atomic number 49.

elements.name: Tin
elements.summary: Tin is a chemical element with symbol Sn and atomic number 50.

elements.name: Antimony
elements.summary: Antimony is a chemical element with symbol Sb and atomic number 51.

elements.name: Tellurium
elements.summary: Tellurium is a chemical element with symbol Te and atomic number 52.

elements.name: Iodine
elements.summary: Iodine is a chemical element with symbol I and atomic number 53.

elements.name: Xenon
elements.summary: Xenon is a chemical element with symbol Xe and atomic number 54.

elements.name: Cesium
elements.summary: Cesium is a chemical element with symbol Cs and atomic number 55. It is a soft, silvery-gold alkali metal with a melting point of 28.5 °C.

elements.name: Barium
elements.summary: Barium is a chemical element with symbol Ba and atomic number 56. It is the fifth element in group 2 and is a soft, silvery alkaline earth metal.

elements.name: Lanthanum
elements.summary: Lanthanum is a chemical element with symbol La and atomic number 57. It is a soft, ductile, silvery-white metal that tarnishes rapidly when exposed to air.

elements.name: Cerium
elements.summary: Cerium is a chemical element with symbol Ce and atomic number 58. Cerium is a soft, ductile and silvery-white metal that tarnishes when exposed to air.

elements.name: Praseodymium
elements.summary: Praseodymium is a chemical element with symbol Pr and atomic number 59. Praseodymium is a soft, silvery, malleable and ductile metal.

elements.name: Neodymium
elements.summary: Neodymium is a chemical element with symbol Nd and atomic number 60. It is one of the rare-earth metals.

elements.name: Promethium
elements.summary: Promethium is a chemical element with symbol Pm and atomic number 61. All of its isotopes are radioactive.

elements.name: Samarium
elements.summary: Samarium is a chemical element with symbol Sm and atomic number 62. It is a moderately hard silvery metal that slowly oxidizes in air.

elements.name: Europium
elements.summary: Europium is a chemical element with symbol Eu and atomic number 63. Europium is the most reactive lanthanide.

elements.name: Gadolinium
elements.summary: Gadolinium is a chemical element with symbol Gd and atomic number 64. Gadolinium is a silvery-white, malleable, and ductile rare earth metal.

elements.name: Terbium
elements.summary: Terbium is a chemical element with symbol Tb and atomic number 65. It is a silvery-white, rare earth metal that is malleable, ductile, and soft enough to be cut with a knife.

elements.name: Dysprosium
elements.summary: Dysprosium is a chemical element with symbol Dy and atomic number 66. It is a rare earth element with a metallic silver luster.

elements.name: Holmium
elements.summary: Holmium is a chemical element with symbol Ho and atomic number 67. Part of the lanthanide series, holmium is a rare-earth element.

elements.name: Erbium
elements.summary: Erbium is a chemical element with symbol Er and atomic number 68. A silvery-white solid metal when artificially isolated.

elements.name: Thulium
elements.summary: Thulium is a chemical element with symbol Tm and atomic number 69. It is the thirteenth and third-last element in the lanthanide series.

elements.name: Ytterbium
elements.summary: Ytterbium is a chemical element with symbol Yb and atomic number 70. It is the fourteenth and penultimate element in the lanthanide series.

elements.name: Lutetium
elements.summary: Lutetium is a chemical element with symbol Lu and atomic number 71. It is a silvery white metal, which resists corrosion in dry air, but not in moist air.

elements.name: Hafnium
elements.summary: Hafnium is a chemical element with symbol Hf and atomic number 72. A lustrous, silvery gray, tetravalent transition metal.

elements.name: Tantalum
elements.summary: Tantalum is a chemical element with symbol Ta and atomic number 73. Previously known as tantalium, it is a rare, hard, blue-gray, lustrous transition metal.

elements.name: Tungsten
elements.summary: Tungsten is a chemical element with symbol W and atomic number 74. The name tungsten comes from the former Swedish name for the tungstate mineral scheelite.

elements.name: Rhenium
elements.summary: Rhenium is a chemical element with symbol Re and atomic number 75. It is a silvery-white, heavy, third-row transition metal in group 7 of the periodic table.

elements.name: Osmium
elements.summary: Osmium is a chemical element with symbol Os and atomic number 76. It is a hard, brittle, bluish-white transition metal in the platinum group.

elements.name: Iridium
elements.summary: Iridium is a chemical element with symbol Ir and atomic number 77. A very hard, brittle, silvery-white transition metal of the platinum group.

elements.name: Platinum
elements.summary: Platinum is a chemical element with symbol Pt and atomic number 78. It is a dense, malleable, ductile, highly unreactive, precious, silverish-white transition metal.

elements.name: Gold
elements.summary: Gold is a chemical element with symbol Au and atomic number 79, making it one of the higher atomic number elements that occur naturally.

elements.name: Mercury
elements.summary: Mercury is a chemical element with symbol Hg and atomic number 80. It is commonly known as quicksilver and was formerly named hydrargyrum.

elements.name: Thallium
elements.summary: Thallium is a chemical element with symbol Tl and atomic number 81. This soft gray post-transition metal is not found free in nature.

elements.name: Lead
elements.summary: Lead is a chemical element with symbol Pb and atomic number 82. It is a heavy metal that is denser than most common materials.

elements.name: Bismuth
elements.summary: Bismuth is a chemical element with symbol Bi and atomic number 83. Bismuth, a pentavalent post-transition metal, chemically resembles its lighter homologs arsenic and antimony.

elements.name: Polonium
elements.summary: Polonium is a chemical element with symbol Po and atomic number 84. A rare and highly radioactive metal with no stable isotopes.

elements.name: Astatine
elements.summary: Astatine is a chemical element with symbol At and atomic number 85. It is the rarest naturally occurring element in the Earth's crust.

elements.name: Radon
elements.summary: Radon is a chemical element with symbol Rn and atomic number 86. It is a radioactive, colorless, odorless, tasteless noble gas.

elements.name: Francium
elements.summary: Francium is a chemical element with symbol Fr and atomic number 87. It is extremely radioactive; its most stable isotope, francium-223, has a half-life of only 22 minutes.

elements.name: Radium
elements.summary: Radium is a chemical element with symbol Ra and atomic number 88. It is the sixth element in group 2 of the periodic table, also known as the alkaline earth metals.

elements.name: Actinium
elements.summary: Actinium is a chemical element with symbol Ac and atomic number 89, which was discovered in 1899. It was the first non-primordial radioactive element to be isolated.

elements.name: Thorium
elements.summary: Thorium is a chemical element with symbol Th and atomic number 90. A radioactive actinide metal, thorium is one of only two significantly radioactive elements that can be found in large quantities in nature.

elements.name: Protactinium
elements.summary: Protactinium is a chemical element with symbol Pa and atomic number 91. It is a dense, silvery-gray actinide metal which readily reacts with oxygen, water vapor and inorganic acids.

elements.name: Uranium
elements.summary: Uranium is a chemical element with symbol U and atomic number 92. It is a silvery-white metal in the actinide series of the periodic table.

elements.name: Neptunium
elements.summary: Neptunium is a chemical element with symbol Np and atomic number 93. A radioactive actinide metal, neptunium is the first transuranic element.

elements.name: Plutonium
elements.summary: Plutonium is a radioactive chemical element with symbol Pu and atomic number 94. It is an actinide metal of silvery-gray appearance that tarnishes when exposed to air.

elements.name: Americium
elements.summary: Americium is a radioactive transuranic chemical element with symbol Am and atomic number 95. This member of the actinide series is located in the periodic table under the lanthanide element europium.

elements.name: Curium
elements.summary: Curium is a transuranic radioactive chemical element with symbol Cm and atomic number 96. This member of the actinide series was named after Marie and Pierre Curie.

elements.name: Berkelium
elements.summary: Berkelium is a transuranic radioactive chemical element with symbol Bk and atomic number 97. It is a member of the actinide and transuranium element series.

elements.name: Californium
elements.summary: Californium is a radioactive chemical element with symbol Cf and atomic number 98. The element was first made in 1950 at the University of California Radiation Laboratory in Berkeley.

elements.name: Einsteinium
elements.summary: Einsteinium is a synthetic element with symbol Es and atomic number 99. Einsteinium is a member of the actinide series and it is the seventh transuranic element.

elements.name: Fermium
elements.summary: Fermium is a synthetic element with symbol Fm and atomic number 100. It is an actinide and the heaviest element that can be formed by neutron bombardment of lighter elements.

elements.name: Mendelevium
elements.summary: Mendelevium is a synthetic element with symbol Md and atomic number 101. A metallic radioactive transuranic element in the actinide series, it is the first element that currently cannot be produced in macroscopic quantities.

elements.name: Nobelium
elements.summary: Nobelium is a synthetic chemical element with symbol No and atomic number 102. It is named in honor of Alfred Nobel, the inventor of dynamite and benefactor of science.

elements.name: Lawrencium
elements.summary: Lawrencium is a synthetic chemical element with symbol Lr and atomic number 103. It is named in honor of Ernest Lawrence, inventor of the cyclotron.

elements.name: Rutherfordium
elements.summary: Rutherfordium is a synthetic chemical element with symbol Rf and atomic number 104, named in honor of physicist Ernest Rutherford.

elements.name: Dubnium
elements.summary: Dubnium is a synthetic chemical element with symbol Db and atomic number 105. Dubnium is highly radioactive: the most stable known isotope, dubnium-268, has a half-life of approximately 28 hours.

elements.name: Seaborgium
elements.summary: Seaborgium is a synthetic chemical element with symbol Sg and atomic number 106. Its most stable known isotope, 269Sg, has a half-life of approximately 14 minutes.

elements.name: Bohrium
elements.summary: Bohrium is a synthetic chemical element with symbol Bh and atomic number 107. It is named after Danish physicist Niels Bohr.

elements.name: Hassium
elements.summary: Hassium is a chemical element with symbol Hs and atomic number 108. Hassium is highly radioactive; its most stable known isotopes have half-lives of approximately ten seconds.

elements.name: Meitnerium
elements.summary: Meitnerium is a synthetic chemical element with symbol Mt and atomic number 109. It is an extremely radioactive synthetic element.

elements.name: Darmstadtium
elements.summary: Darmstadtium is a chemical element with symbol Ds and atomic number 110. It is an extremely radioactive synthetic element.

elements.name: Roentgenium
elements.summary: Roentgenium is a synthetic chemical element with symbol Rg and atomic number 111. It is an extremely radioactive synthetic element that can be created in a laboratory but is not found in nature.

elements.name: Copernicium
elements.summary: Copernicium is a synthetic chemical element with symbol Cn and atomic number 112. Its most stable known isotope, copernicium-285, has a half-life of approximately 28 seconds.

elements.name: Nihonium
elements.summary: Nihonium is a synthetic chemical element with symbol Nh and atomic number 113. It is extremely radioactive; its most stable known isotope, nihonium-286, has a half-life of about 10 seconds.

elements.name: Flerovium
elements.summary: Flerovium is a superheavy artificial chemical element with symbol Fl and atomic number 114. It is an extremely radioactive synthetic element.

elements.name: Moscovium
elements.summary: Moscovium is a synthetic chemical element with symbol Mc and atomic number 115. It was first synthesized in 2003 by a joint team of Russian and American scientists.

elements.name: Livermorium
elements.summary: Livermorium is a synthetic chemical element with symbol Lv and atomic number 116. It is an extremely radioactive element that has only been created in the laboratory.

elements.name: Tennessine
elements.summary: Tennessine is a synthetic chemical element with symbol Ts and atomic number 117. It has the second-highest atomic number and joint-highest atomic mass of all known elements.

elements.name: Oganesson
elements.summary: Oganesson is a synthetic chemical element with symbol Og and atomic number 118. It was first synthesized in 2002 at the Joint Institute for Nuclear Research in Russia.
